project.teaser: Water is central to all human activities, to all components of the EU Green Deal and to several UN SDGs. The Water4All Partnership aims at enabling water security for all on the long term through boosting systemic transformations and changes across the entire research –...
project.objective: Water is central to all human activities, to all components of the EU Green Deal and to several UN SDGs. The Water4All Partnership aims at enabling water security for all on the long term through boosting systemic transformations and changes across the entire research – water innovation pipeline, fostering the matchmaking between problem owners and solution providers. It gathers more than 70 partners, R&I funders, environment ministries, local authorities, European, national and regional-scale networks, research performing organisations. It will collaborate with other relevant R&I initiatives. Water4All proposes a portfolio of multi-national, cross-sectoral activities, targeting a variety of actors, intending to generate the following outputs: - Strengthen the water R&I collaboration at European and international levels, across at least 31 countries, notably through Joint Transnational Calls - Coordinate and leverage the activities of the Water R&I community - Support and promote the demonstration and access to market of innovative solutions - Produce, share and better communicate water-related knowledge & data, from local to global scales - Enhance talent development of water R&I professionals - Foster capacity development and life-long training of water policy-makers, stakeholders and civil society - Design & implement approaches for participatory development of innovation Water4All will run its activities across 7 themes of its strategic agenda: water for circular economy; water for ecosystems and biodiversity; sustainable water management; water and health; water infrastructure; international cooperation; water governance. Water4All’s outputs will contribute to: - Deliver sound knowledge, tools and evidence basis on water for policy- & decision-making - Improve consideration of water impacts in all relevant policies - Enhance the field/market use of innovative solutions to water challenges - Increase citizens’ awareness and engagement for an inclusive water
project.title: Water4All – Water Security for the Planet

programme.title: European Partnership Water Security for the Planet (Water4All)

category.title: Topic

category.title: Global and transnational governance, international law, human rights
category.displayCode: /Global and transnational governance, international law, human rights

result.title: How to conduct impact analysis of Water RDI in Europe
result.description: This deliverable will offer a methodology for impact analysis, aimed at understanding the scientific, socieconomic and political impact of water related projects funded by EU instruments. The results of the impact analysis will inform Water4All's strategic activities.

result.title: Adapt and build on the Aqua Publica Europea Water Erasmus Platform for the use in Water4All (infrastructure development)
result.description: APE exchange platform and toolbox is updated for improved user experience and in line with the Water4All priorities (Task C3.3)

result.title: TAP Terms of Reference
result.description: Terms of reference for the first TAP launched in 2023

result.title: Outlook on development/investment programmes. Third release
result.description: Regular updating on investment programs and new openings. Link with Pillar A and publication in Water4All newsletter

result.title: Report on the design and best practices of training programmes
result.description: A collective report of all tasks under C.3 that summarizes the annual activities of PhD Schemes, VET programmes, Mobility Schemes and Systematic Thinking Capacity Building Programmes (Task C3.1).

result.title: Improvement plan for VET development programmes
result.description: A report that presents mapping of currently existing VET programmes for the water sector and an improvement plan qith a step-by-step process to facilitate excellent craftsmanship (Task C3.2).

result.title: Training course material on systemic thinking published
result.description: Training course materail that addresses the needs of different groups to foster systematic tranformation is published (Task C3.4)

result.title: Initial assessment of communication tools
result.description: This deliverable will be conceived as a progress report that provides an initial evaluation of the suitability of Water4All's communication tools. For this purpose, it will look at the indicators set up in Water4All's communication, dissemination and exploitation plan.

result.title: Young researchers Terms of Reference
result.description: Terms of reference for the first YRC launched in 2023

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: The deliverable will contain a framework for the communication of Water4All's activities, and the dissemination and exploitation of results. The plan will detail opportunities for knowledge exchange with different types of stakeholders and valorisation of Water4All's outcomes.

result.title: First monitoring report on the progress of the Partnership
result.description: Partnership fiche to be included in the EC's biennial monitoring report on the Partnerships, completed with own analysis of the progress of the partnership

result.title: Guidelines for the foresight activitites
result.description: The launch of a foresight activity requires previous planification as regards the definition of the foresight methodology, the list of experts and the organisation of face-to-face and virtual meetings. All these elements will be detailed in D1.3.

result.title: Identification needs Report
result.description: Identification of potential needs and contexts for Living Labs and Demo sites to be linked and aligned with Water4All vision

result.title: Adoption of the Water4All International Strategy; update at M24
result.description: Adoption of criteria for selecting topics and geografical focuses for the Water4All International Strategy

result.title: Outlook on development/investment programmes. First release
result.description: Regular updating on investment programs and new openings. Link with Pillar A and publication in Water4All newsletter

result.title: SRIA 2022-2025: water RDI gaps and needs
result.description: First version of the Water4All Strategic Research and Innovation Agenda (SRIA) laying out gaps in the field of water that should be addressed by Water4All's activities.

result.title: Water4All RPOs are informed about the PhD scheme
result.description: RPOs in Water4All are informed about the PhD schemes process through a dedicated meeting with goal of involving more RPOs in the upcoming PhD schemes (Task C3.1).

result.title: List of PhD students recruited through best practices for open, merit-based, transparent recruitment
result.description: List of PhD students are publsihed on relevant channels (Task C3.1).

result.title: Voucher Schema feasibilty report
result.description: Assessment and definition of the framework of Water4All voucher schemas for innovators

result.title: Entrepreneurship/ Business development training program with focus on inspiration, education and incubation
result.description: Role out a joint and integrated entrepreneurship and business development training program across Europe (Task C2.1) - note: acceleration is part of Task C2.2

result.title: Structuring the public consultation
result.description: The public consultation will not be launched till month 24 but this deliverable will provide information on the key questions to be asked, target groups of respondents and expected outcomes. Results from the public consultation will also be essential in the revision of the SRIA.

result.title: Guidance document on data management in the context of Open Science
result.description: A document to set up the data management priorities and strategies across different Water4All activities in line with FAIR principles (Task C4.2).

result.title: Call documents and annexes JTC2
result.description: The call documents include: Call pre-announcement, Call announcement, National Annexes, Guideline for Evaluators, Guideline for Applicants, Instructions for Proposal submission, Pre-Proposal Template and Full Proposal Template

result.title: Call documents and annexes JTC1
result.description: The call documents include: Call pre-announcement, Call announcement, National Annexes, Guideline for Evaluators, Guideline for Applicants, Instructions for Proposal submission, Pre-Proposal Template and Full Proposal Template.

result.title: Progress report: new inputs for the revised SRIA
result.description: This report will describe inputs for the revised SRIA that will be collected during the first stages of the project and notably from the consultative workshops. Inputs may range from the list of new themes and subthemes, to specific RDI topics and the identification of links between topics.

result.title: Outlook on development/investment programmes. Second release
result.description: Regular updating on investment programs and new openings. Link with Pillar A and publication in Water4All newsletter

result.title: Supporting workshops during international water-related trade shows in M1-M24
result.description: Organization of scoping workshops or other supporting workshops during international trade-shows on water

result.title: Outlook on development/investment programmes. Fourth release
result.description: Regular updating on investment programs and new openings. Link with Pillar A and publication in Water4All newsletter

result.title: Proceedings from the consultative workshops
result.description: Report describing the first two consultative workshops of Water4All. Attention will be paid to the list of participants (organisation, background, domain of expertise), methodology used for the collection of information, and main outcomes. These proceedings will constitute a key element in the revision of the SRIA.

result.title: Mapping of financial programmes and Investor Readiness program
result.description: An Investor Readiness program to prepare water technology entrepreneurs for raising external business and project financing (Task C2.1).

result.title: Thematic policy and technical gaps report
result.description: A report based on foresigh exercises (ex: survey and focus group meetings) organised with policy actors and solution providers to have an in-dept analysis of the implementation challenges and opportunities (Task C1.2).

result.title: Monitoring guidelines JTC1
result.description: The reporting and evaluation format and guidelines for projects funded under JTC, endorsed by the CSC

result.title: List of existing water-related programs managed by various International Organizations worldwide; update at M24
result.description: Searching water-related programmes managed by various International Organizations worldwide

result.title: Survey report on collaborations
result.description: Report on the results of the exploratory meetings/contacts to strengthen the relations between investors and the local eco-business systems done at different levels

result.title: Setting up the tools for mapping the Water RDI sector in Europe
result.description: Description of the methodology to be used (questionnaires, bibliometric analysis, interviews…) to gather information on the RDI system in Europe. The deliverable will also specify the domains for which information will be collected such as national programmes, funding mechanisms, mobility/ training programmes, etc. This deliverable will eventually inform the impact analysis activity to be carried out within Task 2.

result.title: ATLAS of Water Oriented LLs and Demo. First edition
result.description: Creation of a detailed map of Water Oriented Living Labs and Demos

result.title: List of existing agreements or programs of cooperation with third countries; update at M24
result.description: Assessment of the status of agreements and Memorandum of Understanding regarding international cooperation on water-related issues

result.title: Incubator Strategy development
result.description: A strategy to support early stage start-ups and European projects spin-offs, to increase the European water start-ups’ abilities to bring their technology faster to the market (Task C2.2)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
